user_query: film balanced them as well as it could Sarah Hatoff is also another highlight of the film as she kind of follows all the stories along and her reporting is sometimes used as a plot device to get from one scene to another and I thought that was really smart the love Arc with her and chief was kind of forced in and predictable but I'd be lying if I didn't find it cute Isla Fisher put her whole diaphragm into the role of Sarah you can really tell how much fun her and everyone working on this film had recording I did not know she was Beans in Rango and the tooth fairy in Rise of the Guardians that's why we collect the teeth Jack they hold the most important memories of childhood say what you want about him but Ricky Gervais as Flippy the fish gives kind of an awkward unsure of himself performance that really grew on me it reminded me a lot of Richard Ayoade's voice roles eight out of 10 for main characters and voice acting one thing is for certain DreamWorks knows how to make fantastic endings I feel as of recently a lot of animated films have been great but fall flat in the conclusion Department the wild robot and Dog Man are completely different I have no complaints with how they end they both conclude so satisfyingly spoilers but I love Dog Man using the last souvenir the ball from his time with officer Knight to save Petey as he falls into the volcano it's a great metaphor for moving on from the past to create a new future I like the realization Flippy makes about the only
